page.title: 14French Kier Construction
page.content: Over 50 years ago Olaf Kier left Denmark to tour Europe but, he was to remain in England where he built an international construction company whose main headquaters are now based at Tempsford Bedfordshire. In 1928 Kier and his partner Nielsen established a small building firm,its first job was the construction of a concrete bridge in Bath cost Â£500.In 1933 the company was renamed Lotz & Kier and the offices moved from Stoke to Allington House Victoria London. The companies construction activites continued to expand into many new areas. Years of hard work and great gambles paid dividends .Turnover has rapidly increased since the company went public in 1963.
